text: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to impose a minimum tax on individuals and corporations.
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to reduce the maximum individual income rate to 50 percent.

To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to permit taxpayers in qualified States to claim a credit against Federal income tax for 40 percent of the net cost of State income taxes and State general sales taxes, to transfer to the several States the responsibility for certain Federal education and welfare programs, and for other purposes
To regulate and prevent multiple taxation of certain kinds of income
To amend section 2412(b), title 28, United States Code, with respect to the taxation of costs

To amend the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 and the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make funds and tax benefits available to assist job creation and workforce diversification in the golf industry, and for other purposes.

To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow the cost of Industrial or commercial plants and facilities constructed or established in the Appalachian region to be amortized at an accelerated rate for income tax purposes

To authorize private transactions involving the sale, acquisition, or holding of gold within the United States, its Territories and possessions. and for other purposes

A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that the valuation of a decedent's interest in a ranch, farm, or closely held business may at the election of the executor be determined, for estate tax purposes, solely by reference to its value for such use.
